Lt: Gov. Kathy Hochul's claim that women in New York state earn as much as twelve cents more on the dollar than the national average.
Data from the U: S. Bureau of Labor Statistics showing that women in New York state earn 86.9 percent as much as the median pay of men, which is higher than the national average of 81.1 percent.
Comparison of data from the U: S. Census Bureau by the National Women's Law Center, which shows that women in New York state earn 88.7 percent as much as men, the highest level among all states.
